main_definition: Changes or additions made to a document, law, or agreement in order to improve it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Modifications made to legislation after its passage to refine or clarify the original text.
meanings_and_examples.example: The Congress passed amendments to the healthcare bill to address concerns about prescription drug costs.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Changes made to a contract in order to reflect new understandings between parties involved.
meanings_and_examples.example: After negotiations, both companies agreed on several key amendments to their joint venture agreement.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Adjustments or alterations made to a document such as a proposal, plan, or project for better accuracy and clarity.
meanings_and_examples.example: The architect proposed amendments to the building design based on feedback from the community meeting.
